info.title: CI Public API
info.description:
# Introduction
Welcome to the Content Ignite API. A central place for all Content Ignite functionality. 

This API enforces a separation between function and form, meaning anything you can do in our platforms can be replicated in your own bespoke solution.

# Authentication
Authentication is handled via JWTs. You can retrieve your unique JSON Web Token from the settings page in the platform, which needs to be passed in with every request.
To do this, simple include it in an Authorization header with the "Bearer" key word.

Please contact support for help getting started.

# Error Codes
This is a fully RESTful API, so prepare for a number of different HTTP status codes.

There is also a standard "success" field returned for each request. This boolean value can provide a first check against a response.

# Rate limit
We reserve the right to block requests if we deem a client to be abusing the API.

get.description: Fetch a list of user generated reports

post.description:
Create a new report ## Data | **Field Name** | **Field Type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | `title` (optional if `temporary` equals `true`) | `string` | Report title. Used when saving a report for reuse. Max character length 50. | | `temporary` | `boolean` | If true, the report will not show up in the list of reports in the UI. | | `date_range` | `ENUM('custom','yesterday','seven_days','thirty_days','three_months','six_months','last_week','last_month','last_quarter','last_year','week_to_date','month_to_date','quarter_to_date','year_to_date','month_on_month','quarter_on_quarter')` | Pick a dynamic or fixed date range. If `custom` then`custom_date` is also required. | | `fields` | `Array` of `ENUM('account_name','account_owner','ad_impressions','ad_requests','field','ad_responses','field','ad_unit_loads','field','campaign_advertiser','campaign','channel','clicks','config_id','config_name','cost','field','creative_size','ctr','field','date','device','ecpm','field','environment','fill','field','geo','gross_revenue','imp_fill','field','line_item','month','net_revenue','organisation','partner','platform','publisher','q1_impressions','q1_percent','field','q2_impressions','q2_percent','field','q3_impressions','q3_percent','field','q4_impressions','q4_percent','field','region','revenue_source','rpm','field','uid','unit_fill','field','unit','viewability','field','viewable_impressions')` | Pick two or more fields to build the report, note that some fields are incompatible with others. | | `filters` | Object with the following optional properties: `account_name`,`account_owner`,`config_id`,`creative_size`,`campaign`,`campaign_advertiser`,`line_item`,`device`,`environment`,`geo`,`region`,`revenue_source`,`oid`,`partner`,`channel`,`platform`,`uid`,`unit`

in the format `{type: ENUM('include', 'exclude'), matches: Array}` | Filter data on various fields. | | `custom_date` (required if `date_range` is set to `custom`) | `{start: Datetime, end: Datetime}` | Used when `date_range` is set to `custom` to provide the start and end date | ## Fields | **Field Name** | **Field Description** | | --- | --- | | account_name | Account name of the primary platform e.g. your ad server | | ad_impressions | Total impressions served by the ad server | | ad_requests | Total number of requests sent to the ad server | | ad_responses | Total number of ad requests that successfully returned an ad | | ad_unit_loads | Number of times a target match was found on page (not necessarily number of ads requested) | | ag_video_clicks | Number of recirculation click on an auto-generated video | | ag_video_ctr | Percentage of auto-generated video views that clicked through to the article | | ag_video_impressions | Number of impressions on an auto-generated video | | config_id | The ID of the config that matched and served the ad request | | config_name | The name assigned to the config (if available) | | creative_size | The creative size served | | date | Date revenue is attributed to | | device | Device category (desktop,mobile or tablet) | | ecpm | Average cost per 1,000 impressions | | fill | The percentage of ad requests that returned an ad | | geo | Country iso-code | | gross_revenue | Total revenue | | net_revenue | Estimated publishers share of revenue | | oid | Organisation ID | | organisation | Organisation name | | partner | Name of the ad network that sent the winning bid | | platform | Name of the primary platform e.g. your ad server or demand partner connection | | publisher | Publishers domain plus optional label | | q1_impressions | Number of times that a video plays to 25% of its length | | q1_percent | Percentage of views that played to 25% of videos length | | q2_impressions | Number of times that a video plays to 50% of its length | | q2_percent | Percentage of views that played to 50% of videos length | | q3_impressions | Number of times that a video plays to 75% of its length | | q3_percent | Percentage of views that played to 75% of videos length | | q4_impressions | Number of times that a video plays to completion | | q4_percent | Percentage of views that played to video end | | rpm | Estimated publisher revenue per 1,000 ad requests | | uid | The internal unique ID for the publisher | | unit | Unit type e.g. In-image | | unit_fill | The percentage of ad unit loads that returned an ad (can be over 100% if refresh is enabled) | | viewability | Ad impressions that were deemed "viewable" |

get.description: Fetch a reports configuration details
Fetch options available for report filtering
Fetch the data for a given report ID
Fetch a list of experiments with their status and top line configuration
Fetches a full report for the given experiment

put.description: Endpoint to save the table state of an experiment report, allowing user to customise the report view for all who have access to the given report

get.description:
# /v1/report/campaign

Fetches a list of campaign reports, including details such as campaign ID, campaign name, start and end dates, publisher, and status. Use this endpoint to obtain an overview of all campaigns and their current states.

parameters.name: range
parameters.description: Date range for how far to look back for health check reports

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Needed when range is set to "custom"

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Needed when range is set to "custom"

get.description: Returns a list of health check reports for the logged in organisation.
Returns a single health check report
Fetches a simple overview of every publisher in the given networks ads.txt file
Fetches the ads.txt requirements for the given publisher
Fetches the app-ads.txt requirements for the given publisher
Converts a date range preset into a start and end date. Helpful for clearly showing in the UI what a selected date range will map to when pulling a report
Fetch SSP insights data for the given filters
Fetch a list of active SSPs for the given filters, allowing you to filter the data returned from `/report/insights/ssp`
Singular endpoint for fetching CWV data as collected by CI
Singular endpoint for fetching Ads.txt insight data

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Time range in hours to return

get.description: Singular endpoint that fetches the live report data
Fetches top level metrics such as page and ad impressions for the network, or for a given publisher
View revenue over time, including the previous period and a 7 day offset, helping to spot trends

Fetches live revenue data. Note that this does not include all revenue sources (due to limitations in those 3rd party platforms), also data is typically 3 hours behind real-time. Data is useful for tracking how today is trending.
Fetches latency data. Where every millisecond counts in advertising, spotting slowdowns can be vital to improving revenue.
Fetches a list of live checks and up-to-date metrics, to give insight for the here and now
Traffic data, includeing analytics metrics if an analytics integration has been connected.
Network health overview, lists out any common issues that could be impacting revenue
Returns rtope level evenue totals and time series data
Returns data fora. diven dimension; publisher, ad_unit_type, config, geo, region, device, channel, partner, creative_size
Fetches top level revenue stats for fixed date periods
Fetches in-depth data for a singel metric; page_views, sessions, total_users, ad_requests, unit_loads
Fetches top level stats for fixed date periods
Fetches data for all the possible revenue source combinations; (publisher, Content Ignite) and (direct, programatic, fallback)
Fetches demand mix data for a given dimension; partner, channel, advertiser, platform
Fetches a list of campaigns and their associated data for the given time frame
Fetches posible filter values for a given dimension; partner, channel, advertiser, platform

parameters.name: filter_outliers
parameters.description: Filters data outliers that might otherwise skew charts

get.description: Provides Core Web Vital (CWV) benchmarking data
Returns information about how the given publisher has been auto-classified into IAB categories
Fetcheds Ads.txt benchmarking data
Fetched Consent Management Platform (CMP) benchmarking data
Fetches topline stats for SSP benchmarking
Fetches a details brekdown of SSPs for benchmarking

parameters.name: filter_outliers
parameters.description: Filters data outliers that might otherwise skew charts

get.description: Fetches latency benchmarking data
Fetches ad density benchmarking data
Fetches ad delivery benchmarking data
Fetches topline revenue benchmarking stats
Fetches detailed revenue benchmarking data for a given dimension; ad_unit_type, geo, region, device, channel, partner, creative_size
Quick network wide stats, ideal for a landing dashboard usage
Fetches all integrations that suport organisation mapping, the schemas and the data for each
Returns a list of users that have access to the given organisation
Fetches a list of ad stacks in use by the provided publisher
Gets an individual ad stack and all the integrations connected to it
Fetches a list of integrations that could be used to build an ad stack under the given publisher
Fetches an individual integration, The response includes everything needed to configure that integration within an ad stack, such as the schema for any config fields

post.description: Validate the configuration of a given integration. Each integrations requirements vary, so use this endpoint to check all requirements have been met

get.description: Fetches a list of publisher level integrations that could be connected to the given publisher

post.description: Creates an association between a publisher and a publisher level integration (adding it to the "Pub stack")

get.description: Fetches the field schema and data for a single connected integration

delete.description: Deletes the assosication between the publisher and an integration

get.description: Provides an email template for onboarding a publisher. It contains the tag that needs to be deployed and the ads.txt requirents
Fetches the status of the publisher tag and the app sdk for the given publisher
Provides some top line stats for the given publisher, useful for giving a quick visual insight into common metrics
Provides the onboarding tasks for the given publisher, and their status
Fetch a list of organisations that are in the owner hierachy of the given publisher, useful for populating the O&O (Owned & Operated) field on the publisher
Returns the top level configuration for the given publisher

delete.description: Permenantly archives the given publisher, this will stop the tag from serving ads

get.description: Returns a list of experiments for a given publisher
Get the configuration for a given experiment

put.description: Updates an existing config. Actions are restricted for live experiments, to just modifying dates and the title & description

get.description: Takes a list of configs, and returns the differences between them. Used before creating an experiment to confirm the bahavioural subject(s) that the experiment will be testing

put.description: Activates the winnning config of an experiment. This can be run upon completion, or during an experiment, where the experiment will be immmediately terminated

get.description: Fetches the list of configs under the given publisher

post.description: Creates a new config under the given publisher

get.description: Fetches a single publisher config (ad unit)
Fetch a list of all app placements under the given publisher
Fetch the app placement from the given placement ID
Fetches all the publisher level settings for the given publisher

put.description: Sets the publisher level configuration for the given publisher

post.description: Creates a new publisher from the given domain

get.description: List all publishers under the loggedin organisation, and some top level configuration
